meanings.definition: Make an exact copy of; reproduce.
meanings.sent1: Scientists can replicate the experiment to confirm the results.
meanings.sent2: The artist was able to replicate the painting perfectly.
meanings.sent3: I tried to replicate my friend's dance moves, but it was a disaster!
meanings.sent4: Her laughter replicated the sound of a tinkling bell.
meanings.sent5: The machine can replicate any document with incredible accuracy.

meanings.sent1: Please replicate the data before making any changes.
meanings.sent2: The virus was able to replicate itself quickly.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally hit the button to replicate the song on my playlist.
meanings.sent4: His actions seemed to replicate the mistakes of the past.
meanings.sent5: The rumor began to replicate throughout the school like wildfire.

meanings.sent1: The key must replicate the lock for it to open.
meanings.sent2: The colors of the painting perfectly replicate the sunset.
meanings.sent3: His outfit seemed to replicate the style of a famous actor.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness replicated the warmth of a cozy blanket.
meanings.sent5: The new data should replicate the previous findings.
